generalInfo: Flucloxacillin is excreted in breast milk in small amounts; unlikely to be harmful

hepaticImpairment.specificInfo: Use with caution in hepatic impairment; dose adjustment may be needed in severe hepatic impairment.

generalInfo: Generally considered safe during pregnancy when used appropriately.

renalImpairment.specificInfo: Monitor renal function and adjust dose in severe impairment.

sideEffects.specificInfo: Common: Nausea; Vomiting; Diarrhoea; Thrombocytopenia. Uncommon: Rash; Urticaria (hives); Purpura; Arthralgia. Rare: Fever; Cholestatic jaundice; Hepatitis; Neutropenia; Agranulocytosis; Haemolytic anaemia; Anaphylactic shock; Angioedema; Erythema multiforme; Stevens-Johnson syndrome; Toxic epidermal necrolysis; Interstitial nephritis; Convulsions; Myalgia; Pseudomembranous colitis. Frequency not known: Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis (AGEP); Oesophageal pain; Hypokalaemia.
